Ref Table(s).100: WELL WELL_TESTWELL_TEST_RECOVERYWELL_ACTIVITYWELL_CORE_DESCRIPTIONPROD_STRINGPROD_STRING_FORMATION

Column Comment.0: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.1: ANALYSIS SOURCE: The source that the analysis came from, this could be a labtechnician, a lab, a company, a government agency, etc.
Column Comment.2: COMPONENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the component that isassociated with the sample analysis.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: ACTIVITY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number uniquely identifying each observationof an activity.
Column Comment.5: APPLICATION ID: Unique identifier for applications you make for continuations,licenses etc. to the government.
Column Comment.6: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.7: AREA TYPE ID: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.8: BA AUTHORITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the row that describes theauthority that a business associate has over business objects.
Column Comment.9: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for anorganization of a company or organization.
Column Comment.10: ORGANIZATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique number added to alloworganizations to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.11: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.12: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofadditives. Think of this table as a catalogue of all the kinds of additives that can bepurchased or created.
Column Comment.13: EQUIPMENT CATALOGUE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofequipment. Think of this as a catalogue or brochure that shows all the kinds ofequipment that you may use, but may or may not actually have. Actual pieces ofequipment that exist are defined in the table EQUIPMENT.
Column Comment.14: CLASSIFICATION: SYSTEM: Identifies and describes the classification system thatis used. The UNSPSC code set is a useful and practical source of classificationinformation.
Column Comment.15: CLASSIFICATION LEVEL IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier used to capture theclassification systems, such as those that describe types of equipment. A number ofclassification schemes are available, including the UNSPSC code set. Typically,these classification systems are hierarchical. Objects may be classified at any level ofthe classification system, and through more than one classification system.
Column Comment.16: COMPONENT TYPE: The component type associated with this sample analysis.
Column Comment.17: CONSENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the consent. Consents grantpermission to conduct operations based on approval of what is done or proposed byanother. Conditions, including actions to be taken or fees to be paid, may or may notbe applied against the consent.
Column Comment.18: CONSULTATION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this consultation as it pertains toan activity or request for an activity. Consultation discussions may occur at any pointin the life cycle of a business object.
Column Comment.19: CONTESTMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier to track a contestment betweencompanies, countries, states and other jurisdictional bodies.
Column Comment.20: CONTRACT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.21: CORE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the core.
Column Comment.22: CORE TYPE: Defines the type of core procedure used during the coring operation.For example, conventional, sidewall, diamond, triangle, etc.
Column Comment.23: DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequence number assigned to allowfor multiple core descriptions.
Column Comment.24: ECOZONE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sedimentary rock unit or environmentin which fossil deposition occurs. Often, these ecozones are marine or fresh water.Marine ecozones include the category of marine benthic zones, namely shelf, slope,and abyssal zones. The ecozone is defined by the organisms that are found in it.
Column Comment.25: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first comes into effect.
Column Comment.26: EMPLOYEE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: The unique identifier assigned toan employee (or consultant or contractor) in an organization.
Column Comment.27: EMPLOYEE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential counter that tracks anemployees moves within an organization.
Column Comment.28: EMPLOYER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: The unique identifier of theorganization that has employees working for it.
Column Comment.29: ENTITLEMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the row in the entitlement table.
Column Comment.30: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific piece of equipment used inthe sample analysis.
Column Comment.31: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row is no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.32: FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.33: FACILITY TYPE: Identifies the codes classifying the facility according to its physicalequipment or principal service performed. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE willeventually become a SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.34: FIELD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the field that the sample to be analyzedcame from.
Column Comment.35: FIELD STATION IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for the field station that the sampleto be analyzed came from.
Column Comment.36: FINANCE SUIMMARY IDENTIFIER: Summary information about a financialreference, such as an AFE for an activity, such as seismic acquisition or processing.Could be a cost center or any other reference number.
Column Comment.37: FOSSIL IDENTIFIER: Unique Identifier for a fossil.
Column Comment.38: INCIDENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an health safety or environment relatedincident.
Column Comment.39: INCIDENT SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set of incident types that may bemandated by an operating company, regulatory agency or contract.
Column Comment.40: INCIDENT TYPE: The type of incident that may have occurred, such as roll-over, orexplosion, or unsafe materials handling.
Column Comment.41: INFORMATION ITEM ID: The unique identifier for an information item.
Column Comment.42: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.43: INSTRUMENT ID: Unique number for the legal document registered on the Cert. OfTitle indicating interest in lands e.g. charge, lien, mortgage, caveat. May be naturalKey or system assigned, based on user needs and uniqueness of natural ids.
Column Comment.44: INTEREST SET IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the interest set.
Column Comment.45: INTEREST SET SEQUENCE NUMBER: unique sequencing component to allowversioning of the interest set over time.
Column Comment.46: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for the jurisdiction that is managing theland sale or bidding round.
Column Comment.47: LAND RIGHT IDENTIFIER: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is therights you have to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented,acquired by agreement or contract.
Column Comment.48: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: column indicating the type of land right. Must be one of thevalid subtypes: LAND TITLE, LAND UNIT, LAND UNIT TRACT, LANDAGREEMENT, LAND AGREE PART.
Column Comment.49: LAND SALE NUMBER: A unique number used to identify the land sale.
Column Comment.50: LANGUAGE: The form of a means of communicating ideas or feelings by the use ofconventionalized signs, sounds, gestures, or marks having understood meanings.Usually the language used in a document, proceeding, process or application.
Column Comment.51: LITHOLOGY LOG ID: A unique identifier for a descriptive record of lithology.
Column Comment.52: LITH LOG SOURCE: The source of data for this lithologic log.
Column Comment.53: NOTIFICATION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the notification.
Column Comment.54: OBLIGATION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for each obligation.
Column Comment.55: OBLIGATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: Unique identifier for each part or occurrence ofan obligation.
Column Comment.56: PALEO SUMMARY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the paleo summary report thatis captured.
Column Comment.57: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.58: PDEN SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designatedas the source of information for this row
Column Comment.59: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.60: PHYSICAL ITEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for the physical item that containsthe actual sample. In some cases, the sample is divided into portions; in this case,each portion is described in SAMPLE_ORIGIN and a foreign key from RMPHYSICAL ITEM identifies the location of the sample itself. Note that these foreignkeys are provided as a denormalized column. The nominal location for thisinformation is RM_INFO_ITEM_CONTENT.
Column Comment.61: POOL IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying the pool.
Column Comment.62: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.63: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.64: PPDM TABLE NAME: The name of a table that has an association with this level of aclassification system. This may be used in conjunction with an appropriate foreignkey from the table that is referenced, or may be used generically in combination withthe
Column Comment.65: PRODUCT_TYPE: The product identified as a component for this table.
Column Comment.66: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.67: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project.
Column Comment.68: WELL STRING FORMATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequential observationnumber used to uniquely identify each completed (perforated) formation (layer) that iscontributing production to a well string.
Column Comment.69: RATE and FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided.
Column Comment.70: RECOVERY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Observation number defining theuniqueness of each recovery type.
Column Comment.71: PPDM REFERENCED GUID: The GUID in the table that has an association with thislevel of a classification system. In this case, we recommend that the name of thetable also be captured in PPDM TABLE, to make querying this information easier.Usually, the PPDM TABLE and PPDM REFERENCED GUID should be used intandem. In this case, it is essential that the PPDM GUID in the source table bemanaged carefully and appropriately.
Column Comment.72: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.73: PPDM TABLE NAME: The name of a table that has an association with this level of aclassification system. This may be used in conjunction with an appropriate foreignkey from the table that is referenced, or may be used generically in combination withthe PPDM_REFERENCED_GUID, which points to the row in the table that is relatedto the classification system level. In this case, it is essential that the PPDM GUID inthe source table be managed carefully and appropriately.
Column Comment.74: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.75: REPORTED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this value was reported ratherthan calculated or measured.
Column Comment.76: RESERVES ENTITY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a reserves entity. A reservesentity may be comprised of a single business object (such as a well) or a group ofbusiness objects (such as all the completions producing from a pool).
Column Comment.77: RESERVE CLASS IDENTIFIER: The reserve classed for identifying the confidencelevel and producing status of the reserve volumes.
Column Comment.78: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.79: SAMPLE DATE: Date the sample was taken from the well, especially if not collectedfrom a well test
Column Comment.80: SAMPLE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample used in technical analysis.
Column Comment.81: SAMPLE SOURCE: The source of the sample, such as well drilling cuttings, wellcore, drilling mud, stratigraphic field station, etc. In addition, foreign keys are providedto allow direct associations between the sample and technical analysis.
Column Comment.82: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.83: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Validentries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.84: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.85: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.86: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of land. Thesurface description may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes andbounds or polygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals(substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) to which rights are granted.For land rights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatialdescription.
Column Comment.87: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.88: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the preparation and processing of the sample. This column is asufficient method to keep track of what is done in the sample analysis. However, ifthe requirement for more complicated tracking such as two steps occurringsimultaneously or if steps are needed to be added to the initial procedure, use thetwo columns STEP_SEQ_NO1 and STEP_SEQ_NO2 in the tableANL_STEP_XREF.
Column Comment.89: DATA STORE ID: Used to identify the kinds of items that a data store structure ispermitted to hold.
Column Comment.90: DATA STORE STRUCTURE OBS NO: Used to identify the kinds of items that a datastore structure is permitted to hold.
Column Comment.91: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.92: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.93: STRING IDENTIFIER: Number or code uniquely identifying a production string withina well.
Column Comment.94: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on. Sub tyes are used tomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.95: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.96: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.97: TEST TYPE: The type of test being performed on the sample. For example,pyrolysis, pH levels, viscosity testing, Drill Stem Tests (DST), Repeat FormationTests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP), etc.
Column Comment.98: RECORDS MANAGEMENT THESAURUS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set ofwords or descriptors about a particular field or set of concepts, such as a list ofsubject headings or descriptors usually with a cross-reference system for use in theorganization of a collection of documents for reference and retrieval (from MerriamWebster Online)
Column Comment.99: THESAURUS WORD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a word or key word in athesaurus.
Column Comment.100: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.101: WELL ACTIVITY IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for the well activity.
Column Comment.102: WELL ACTIVITY SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a valid set of activity codes,such as those required by a regulatory or professional agency.
Column Comment.103: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.104: WELL ACTIVITY TYPE: The type of activity that is tracked, such as drilling, testing,coring, tubing etc. May be any kind of activity related to well operations.
Column Comment.105: WELL CORE DESCRIPTION IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for the well coredescription. The well core decryption is a narrative description about the well core.For example, the color, chemical composition, physical description of the coresediment.
Column Comment.106: WELL TEST IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for the well test.
Column Comment.107: WELL TEST RECOVERY IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for the recovery of a welltest, such as Drill Stem Tests (DST), Repeat Formation Tests (RFT), InitialPotential(IP).
Column Comment.108: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.109: WELL TEST TYPE: identifies the general type of test used to evaluate the potentialof the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), Repeat Formation Tests (RFT),Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.110: WORK ORDER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the work order.
Column Comment.111: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.112: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.113: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.114: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.115: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.116: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.117: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
